main event: A round, white/silver object the size of a basketball was sighted on the ground near Tahoka, Texas for 1 hour and 30 minutes on November 13, 1957.
interesting points: The object appeared to be egg-shaped and changed in size from basketball to larger.
Two T-33 aircraft from Reese AFB attempted to intercept the object but were unable to get close to its altitude.
A weather balloon was released from Holloman AFB around the same time, but was determined to be too far away to be the same object.
The sighting was reported by multiple reliable witnesses at Reese AFB, including the control tower operator, pilots, and other personnel.
The object oscillated sideways on a north-south axis and eventually went out of sight about 12.5 miles east of Reese AFB.
sighted object: a round, white/silver object the size of a basketball
witnesses: multiple reliable personnel at Reese AFB, including control tower operators and pilots
photographs: no photographs present in the report
